Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2013 02:14AM ilovemykids wrote: I am five years out as well! I haven't been in this site in so long. I am off tamoxifen. It feels so great to feel normal again. I was dx in August 08.my last chemo was mid December 08. I heard that I can finally say I am in remission on the fifth anniversary of my last chemo treatment. Two weeks to go!
Posts.Title: 5 Years ago momand2kids ilovemykids

Posts.Content: May 30, 2009 08:08PM ilovemykids wrote: Hi ladies, I am just here to give you a little light at the end of the tunnel!  I am 23 weeks past my last chemo and I have a full head of beautiful, thick soft hair.  All my lashes and brows.  I was so scared that I would not have my hair again.  You know what, loosing our hair is a small price for us to pay, for the insurance that it gives us.  I never thought of my hair before I had bc.  I am so appreciative, and happy for so much more now.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2008 09:08PM ilovemykids wrote: Hi Girls! I am so frightened and find myself crying so much.  I know that I can do this, and I really want to, because I only want the longest possible life.  I feel like I have been in a dream over the last month or so.  I tried on my wig today, just to see how I would feel in public, and I felt stupid.  I have good days and bad days, but I am sad.  I just want my life back.  I know that I can do this!  I am still waiting for my oncotypedx score.  Please pray with me for a low number.  Thanks for the support,  Love, Elizabeth
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2008 04:53PM ilovemykids wrote: Hi Everyone, I start my first round of TC next Tuesday.  I am keeping myself positive, and I am just going to try to be very strong.  I am frightened, but I am excited to know that the sooner I start, the sooner I will be finished.  We are still waiting on my Oncotype score.  I am praying for a low number, and sort of believe that it will be low, just intuitively, so I hope I am right.  Can anyone tell me how long they imagine I will be in the "chair" during the treatment?  I was wondering about that.  I counted the days...64, from start of treatment until the last treatment.  I have my wigs lined up, along with hats and these weird sort of hair halos?  Does anyone use hair halos for under hats?  I am just trying to get ultra prepared.  Let me know what I should go out and get before Tues.  Thanks ladies, I hope to hear back from you. Love, Elizabeth
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2008 03:40PM ilovemykids wrote: Hi ladies,  Well,I feel terrible today.  I had my first treatment of TC on Tuesday,and now it hits like a ton of bricks.  My hips hurt so bad, I can not eat a thing, throat kills, headache, oh and the best part...started my period day #2.  Please tell me this will get better.  I am taking all of your advice and tips! Love, Elizabeth

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2008 09:41PM ilovemykids wrote: kristi, you probably are not as anemic as me...ask your onc.  I will tell you that I feel much better with the iron  It helps with the rbc's.  My wbc's were 2 over the weekend so I really stayed away from everyone.  I still feel tired all the time.  Who knows.  I think we just have to be so precautios during this period.  I feel better knowing someone else feels like a hermit and that I am not alone.  this whole ordeal has been strange to me...I want my old life back. bluedasher,  boy you have a lot to deal with.  I think that you just need to ask all of the questions and really keep on those doctors.  I am going to say a prayer for you.  I hope that you will be fine, and I think that you will.  Remember, we tend to over analyze everything, and we always jump to the worst conclusions.  It really is not in our best interest!  Hugs
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2008 02:28PM ilovemykids wrote: Hi Annie and Kristi and all my fellow friends! Annie, I think that it takes awhile for every bit of soreness tingling or pain makes us wonder about mets!  You just got a bad, bad, cold and it is so hard to get better when you are undergoing all of this chemo!  I guess I won't feel too bad about being so reclusive right now.  I am looking forward to the new year, to new hair and to my old life! I don't think this ordeal is easy, but it is worth the fight.  I have my last treatment next Tuesday.  I can't say I am looking forward to it, but I want to get it done.  I am a bit worried because my WBC were 2 on Saturday.  Do you ladies know how much they should increase by next Tuesday.  Please let me know.

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2008 04:04PM ilovemykids wrote: HI Kathy,  You hang in there.  This is so scary but we can do it.  I start in the morning.  I am not looking forward to it, but at least it will be one more thing to get over with.  It seems that the more you think, the crazier your thoughts get.  Try to find something for a distraction when your mind starts racing!  You are not alone...I feel just like you.  You will do well! Love, Elizabeth
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2008 12:00PM ilovemykids wrote: Hi Everyone, Well yesterday was treatment #1 for me.  I am happy that I made it through and now have just three more to face.  I know that I have much in store, but I am just happy that I made it through the first infusion.  It took two hours, no problems with the vein.  The gave benadryl and ativan iv prior to the drips.  Felt fine yesterday, and so far feel okay this morning.  I will keep you posted.  It was not as bad as I was afraid of.  Thanks for your supportive words, Love, Elizabeth

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2008 07:15PM ilovemykids wrote: Hi Everyone!  I hope you are doing okay!  Finished round 2 of 4 on Tuesday.  Glad that that is over!  Felt bad days 2,3,4!  Better today. My hair is very thin but not all gone. I did not shave it.  It is thin all over!  I do not go out in public with it, I wear hats or the wig.  I just don't feel like shaving it off.  Also I am going to see how much stays.  I know it will most likely all go, but I am just watching it.  The scalp is not as sore as it used to be.  You gradually get accustomed to all of this.  I would say that tx #2 was much like the first one, so maybe that is how it will be.  I have to go in for iron infusions...Tues morning, since I am very anemic. they make me feel better. Looking forward to feling better still this week.  I hope you guys are hanging in there.  Good luck to all of you sisters getting treatments this week.  One step at a time, we are getting through this! Annie...how is your cold?  Did you fair well?  I hope you are fine!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2008 02:05PM - edited Nov 30, 2008 02:10PM by ilovemykids Hi Kristi,  haven't done it without.  I think the Decadron really helps because every time I come off of it I feel really bad!  It makes you feel so weird, but it helps me.  Continue drinking lots and lots of water.  Ativan helps too, if you have that.  Do whatever you can to help yourself through the hump.  Also...GOOD LUCK, you will do great!  I am sure you will do fine without the decadron!  We are all different!

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2008 12:52PM ilovemykids wrote: Kristi, I was so anemic even before the start of my chemotherapy.  She started me on a series of iron infusions and it has helped me so much.  I am not anemic, even through all of the chemo. I was just wondering if any one else feels like a hermit?  I feel like I just want to stay inside and away from people.  This is so unusual for me because I usually am always on the go.  I don't even want to talk to friends on the phone.  I did not go to my daughters parent teacher conference, had my husband go without me.  Is this depression?  I have never been like this.

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 01:10PM ilovemykids wrote: Dear Denise,  I am glad you made it through the start!  Now you have one more "unknown" out of the way for yourself.  You are right about your comments, and I am getting stronger through this and feeling less guilty.  You will probably find, as I have, that as you go through this, it gets a bit easier only because, you get the "unknown" out of the way.  Remember how horrible it was just waiting for our initial diagnosis, and then the next results, etc.  Before long, this will all be in our past.  Everything that comes around in our lives, shapes us; we should make this into something meaningful and use it to our advantage!  I will not let this change me for the worse, but only for the better.  Tina, good luck, you are going to do great.  The Decadron helps, trust me!  I just finished round 2/4 on Tuesday.

Posts.Content: ilovemykids wrote: Can someone please let me know if they had to choose between these two chemo treatments and what the differece is.  I am having such a hard time with this.  Thanks Love, Elizabeth! Posts.Title: AC followed byT vs. TC ilovemykids ilovemykids

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2008 01:27PM ilovemykids wrote: Hi Denise, I am just one treatment ahead of you.  Had my second yesterday.  Doing fine just to let you know.  The road has not always been easy, but believe me I make this a personal testament to my life.  I love my life, everything about it, and I want to be here as long as I possibly can.     I am still not wearing a wig.  So this is day 23.  I had planned to shave my head, bought wigs, have hats and all.  I surprised myself, because I, like you was just waiting to see what would happen, and listened to all of the advice about when my hair would thin, bald, whatever.  For me, day 15 it started to fall a bit. By day 18 it was itching and more would come out...I was ready to shave it, but instead, just let what was going to come out, do so.  I am happy with this choice, as I can wear a hat and still have my bangs and all else that I do have.  H& M has cute ones!  To each his own and all choices about our hair is fine.  This is temporary!  We can do this, and you know what, we will have richer lives, with more empathy, understanding, wisdom, and  courage because of this roadblock.  Hats off to you!  No puns intended.  YOU CAN DO THIS!!!!
Posts.Title: Getting ready to start Taxotere and Cytoxan Onehalf Onehalf
